About the job Before you apply to a job, select your language preference from the options available at the top right of this page. Explore your next opportunity at a Fortune Global 500 organization. Envision innovative possibilities, experience our rewarding culture, and work with talented teams that help you become better every day. We know what it takes to lead UPS into tomorrow—people with a unique combination of skill + passion. If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level. Job Description Job Description UPS is seeking a motivated and experienced Senior UX Designer to join our Digital Experience team. In this role, you will own end-to-end design initiatives, collaborating closely with product managers, researchers, engineers, and fellow designers to deliver intuitive, accessible, and scalable digital experiences that support the world’s most trusted logistics network. You’ll act as a design leader, advocating for user-centered solutions, mentoring junior designers, and contributing to our enterprise-level design system. Responsibilities Lead Design Projects: Own the UX design lifecycle for complex web and mobile applications—from initial discovery and user research through wireframing, high-fidelity prototyping, usability testing, and final handoff. Drive UX Strategy: Partner with product stakeholders to define user experience goals, translate business requirements into design concepts, and ensure alignment with overall product vision. Design System Governance: Contribute to the evolution of our enterprise design system and UI component library. Establish and enforce design standards, patterns, and best practices to maintain consistency across multiple products and platforms. User Research & Validation: Plan and facilitate user interviews, focus groups, and usability studies. Synthesize research findings into personas, user journeys, and actionable insights that inform design decisions. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Product Management and Engineering to ensure designs are technically feasible, accessible (WCAG AA or higher), and performant. Align on implementation details, provide design specifications, and participate in sprint ceremonies as needed. Visual & Interaction Design: Create polished, pixel-perfect mockups, interactive prototypes, and detailed UI specifications using tools like Figma, Sketch, or Adobe XD. Communicate interaction patterns, micro-animations, and motion guidelines. Mentorship & Leadership: Provide guidance, feedback, and coaching to junior and mid-level designers. Participate in design critiques, facilitate workshops, and help establish a culture of continuous improvement. Stakeholder Communication: Present design concepts, trade-off analyses, and research summaries to senior leadership. Advocate for users by articulating design rationale and quantifying expected impact (e.g., engagement metrics, task success rates). Continuous Improvement: Stay current with industry trends, emerging tools, and best practices in UX, UI, and accessibility. Identify opportunities to optimize existing workflows, introduce new methodologies (e.g., design ops), and share learnings with the broader team. Qualifications Experience: 5+ years of hands-on UX/UI design experience in an enterprise or large-scale environment, with a portfolio showcasing complex, end-to-end projects (web and mobile). Education: Bachelor’s degree (or higher) in Human-Computer Interaction, Interaction Design, Graphic Design, Computer Science, Psychology, or a related field. Equivalent experience may be considered. Design Tools & Prototyping: Expert proficiency in Figma for wireframing, high-fidelity mockups, and interactive prototyping. User Research & Testing: Demonstrated experience designing and moderating user research sessions, conducting usability tests (remote and in-person), and translating findings into design decisions and metrics. Design Systems & Component Libraries: Hands-on experience building, maintaining, or scaling a design system (e.g., defining tokens, components, and documentation). Ability to collaborate with engineering teams to implement and evolve shared UI libraries. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Proven track record of partnering effectively with product managers, engineers, and researchers to drive alignment and deliver high-quality user experiences. Ability to balance business objectives, technical constraints, and user needs. Accessibility & Inclusive Design: Solid understanding of accessibility standards (WCAG 2.1 AA or higher) and inclusive design principles. Experience auditing interfaces for accessibility and implementing remediation strategies. Visual & Interaction Design: Strong visual design chops, attention to typography, spacing, color theory, and interaction detail. Experience defining motion guidelines and micro-interactions to enhance usability. Communication & Leadership: Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to present design rationale and data-driven insights to senior leadership. Prior experience mentoring or leading other designers is highly desirable. Technical Familiarity: Basic understanding of front-end technologies (HTML/CSS/JavaScript or React) to facilitate handoff and collaboration with engineering teams. Portfolio: Submit a portfolio or work samples demonstrating your process—from research and ideation through prototyping, visual design, and final implementation. Preferred Qualifications Experience working in a logistics, supply chain, or enterprise SaaS environment. Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies and working within two-week sprint cycles. Experience using analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Mixpanel) to measure user behavior and inform design decisions. Familiarity with agile project management tools such as Jira or Azure DevOps. Employee Type Permanent UPS is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

We’re looking for a UX Designer who is passionate about crafting intuitive, engaging, and visually compelling digital experiences. If you thrive on problem-solving, love storytelling through design, and are eager to push the boundaries of user experience in a rapidly evolving digital landscap e, then this role is for you! What You’ll Do You always start with a UI Kit to inform your product’s design journey. Leverage human-centered design principles to create smooth, intuitive, and accessible digital experiences. Research and design data-backed personas, user flows, and scenarios to optimize UX. Create responsive, multi-channel UI/UX designs for web and mobile (hybrid, native, and SPAs). Use industry-leading interactive prototyping tools such as Figma, Sketch, etc. to validate designs. Do you know better ones? We are always open to suggestions. Work closely with product managers, developers, and marketing teams to refine user-centric solutions. Implement inclusive design standards for diverse user groups. Provide structured CSS, HTML, and image assets to engineering teams. Bring information to life through engaging data visualizations and interactive elements. What You Bring Bachelor’s/Master’s in UX/UI Design, HCI, Computer Science, Interaction Design, or a related field. 3+ years in UX/UI design, working on modern digital products. Proficiency in Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, Azure or other top-tier UX tools. Experience in user testing, usability research, and data-driven design decision-making. Strong understanding of visual hierarchy, typography, color theory, and information architecture. Knowledge of designing multi-platform experiences is a plus! You think outside the box, stay ahead of trends, and tell compelling design stories. Ability to articulate design decisions with a clear rationale and influence stakeholders. Bundle of energy . L oads of it! Bonus Points If You Have experience in AI-powered UX. Are passionate about motion design and micro-interactions. Have worked on B2B SaaS, Travel, Hospitality , or E-commerce products . Know basics of HTML, CSS, or JavaScript. Why You’ll Love Working Here Be part of an upbeat team in a lean, startup environment. Work on innovative, high-impact projects. Be part of a design-driven culture that values creativity. Global exposure and cutting-edge tech adoption. Growth opportunities in an exciting and evolving UX landscape.

About the job UX Researcher Location - Gurgaon (Onsite) Years of Experience - 4-7 years Department - Design/ Research About the Job As a User Experience Researcher specializing in Real Money Gaming (RMG) at Zupee, you will play a pivotal role in enhancing the user experience for our RMG platform. This role involves conducting comprehensive research, gathering insights, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure our gaming experiences are engaging, intuitive, and meet the expectations of our users. Key Responsibilities: User Research in Gaming: Plan and execute user interviews, surveys, and usability studies tailored to the unique aspects of real money gaming. Work closely with product teams to understand user behaviors, preferences, and pain points in the gaming context. Usability Testing for Gaming Platforms: Design and conduct usability testing sessions specific to real money gaming platforms. Collaborate with game designers and developers to implement user feedback and improve gaming interactions. Data Analysis Mastery: Analyze complex data sets, both quantitative and qualitative, to derive actionable insights and provide strategic recommendations for product improvements. Utilize statistical methods to interpret user behavior patterns and trends. Competitor Analysis in RMG: Stay abreast of trends and advancements in the real money gaming industry. Conduct thorough competitive analysis to identify opportunities and maintain a competitive edge. Collaboration with Gaming Teams: Collaborate effectively with gaming designers, product managers, and developers to integrate user insights seamlessly into the gaming development process. Communicate research findings through clear and impactful presentations. Thought Leadership: S tay abreast of industry trends, advancements, and emerging technologies within UX research. Contribute to thought leadership within the organization through presentations, workshops, and knowledge-sharing sessions. V endor Management & Recruitment Manage existing vendors and on-board new vendors for vendor selection and vendor relationships for research services. Work with various partners and vendors to identify target groups for studies. Influence and guide recruitment of participants through development of participant screeners that are relevant to each research project. Ensure that the vendors present deep and detailed insights for studies that they are responsible for conducting. Q ualifications: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, UX Design, or a related field. 3+ years of experience in user experience research with a proven track record of successful projects.P proficiency in various research methodologies and tools. Experience working with market research vendors. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. strong communication skills, both written and verbal. P referred Skills: Proven experience in user experience research within the real money gaming domain. Experience with usability testing tools and software tailored for gaming environments. Knowledge of UX/UI design principles. ability to thrive in a collaborative and fast-paced gaming environment. Benefits: Competitive salary with performance bonuses. Opportunities for professional development and career advancement. comprehensive health and wellness programs. Flexible work schedule to maintain work-life balance. Join Our Winning Team: If you're passionate about shaping the user experiences in the real money gaming space and eager to contribute to an innovative and dynamic industry, we invite you to join us. Apply now and let's create exceptional gaming experiences together!

About the job Hogarth is the Global Content Experience Company. Part of WPP, Hogarth partners with one in every two of the world’s top 100 brands including Coca-Cola, Ford, Rolex, Nestlé, Mondelez and Dyson. With a breadth of experience across an extensive range of sectors, Hogarth offers the unrivaled ability to deliver relevant, engaging, and measurable content across all channels and media - both established and emerging. The number of channels at our fingertips; the need for speed; and the drive for mass personalisation, all mean that brands need different solutions. Our global team of over 7,500 craft and technology experts brings together creative, production and innovation to help clients navigate this exciting and ever-changing world of today’s content experience. WPP is the creative transformation company. We use the power of creativity to build better futures for our people, planet, clients and communities. Working at WPP means being part of a global network of more than 100,000 talented people dedicated to doing extraordinary work for our clients. We operate in over 100 countries, with corporate headquarters in New York, London and Singapore. WPP is a world leader in marketing services, with deep AI, data and technology capabilities, global presence and unrivalled creative talent. Our clients include many of the biggest companies and advertisers in the world, including approximately 300 of the Fortune Global 500. Our people are the key to our success. We're committed to fostering a culture of creativity, belonging and continuous learning, attracting and developing the brightest talent, and providing exciting career opportunities that help our people grow. A Hybrid working model We believe the best work happens when we're together, fostering creativity, collaboration, and connection. That's why we’ve adopted a hybrid approach, with teams in the office around four days a week. About the job Please note that we will never request payment or bank account information at any stage of the recruitment process. As we continue to grow our teams, we urge you to be cautious of fraudulent job postings or recruitment activities that misuse our company name and information. Please protect your personal information during any recruitment process. While Monks may contact potential candidates via LinkedIn, all applications must be submitted through our official website ( monks.com/careers ). Summary We are seeking a talented and passionate UX/UI Designer to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for creating intuitive, engaging, and visually appealing user experiences across our clients digital products and services. You will work collaboratively with product managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to translate user needs and business goals into innovative design solutions. The ideal candidate possesses a strong understanding of user-centered design principles, a keen eye for visual aesthetics, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment. Responsibilities You may be asked to conduct user research and gather or distill insights through various methods (e.g., user interviews, surveys, usability testing, desktop research) . Create user flows, wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity mockups to effectively communicate experience solutions and design ideas. Design intuitive user interfaces and content pieces that are both visually appealing, easy to use and align with the clients brand guidelines. Collaborate with cross functional team members and client stakeholders to ensure design feasibility and alignment with business objectives. Develop and maintain design systems and style guides to ensure consistency across all products. Conduct usability testing and iterate on designs based on user feedback. Stay up-to-date with the latest UX/UI trends and technologies. Advocate for the user and champion user-centered design principles throughout the organization. Present design work to stakeholders and clearly articulate design rationale. Prioritize your time across multiple project needs. Requirements Must have Proven experience as a UX/UI Designer or similar role. A strong portfolio showcasing your design skills and experience. Proficiency in design and prototyping tools specifically Figma, including knowledge of design library,system creation and management. Solid understanding of user-centered design principles, interaction design, and visual design. Ability to create user flows, wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity mockups. Excellent communication, collaboration, and presentation skills. Strong problem-solving and analytical skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Experience with responsive design and mobile-first design principles. Nice to have Experience conducting user research and usability testing and desk research activities to distill insights to create direction based on your recommendations. Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript is a plus. Experience in using AI tools to enhance you workflow and output. What The Candidate Brings Design Prowess & Portfolio: A visually stunning online portfolio showcasing approximately 5+ years of relevant digital and web design experience. Demonstrates exceptional presentation, research, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills in your process. Unwavering Curiosity: A thirst for continuous learning and pushing creative boundaries, both personally and professionally. You're eager to explore new technologies and design trends. Exceptional Collaboration & Communication: A people-centric approach with strong social and communication skills, enabling you to understand and connect with colleagues and clients from diverse backgrounds. Understanding of the Landscape: A feel for the dynamics of product development and the nuances of bringing designs to life. Constructive Mindset: A critical eye for detail, balanced with a positive and encouraging approach. You understand that a blend of recognition and constructive feedback motivates others to excel. Mastery of Design Fundamentals: A thorough understanding of design fundamentals, including typography, interaction design, usability, grid systems, white space, aspect ratios, and color theory, with obsessive attention to detail. Confidence & Leadership: Confidence in tackling high-end projects in collaboration with colleagues and clients, demonstrating leadership when appropriate. Tool Proficiency: Mastery of modern design and prototyping tools (Specifically Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, etc.). You maintain organized files, layers, and folders to facilitate seamless collaboration. UX Judgement: Based on experience and expertise, you can evaluate the quality of user experiences and articulate actionable recommendations for improvement using UX terms and methodologies. Mindful Execution: Mindful of time, budget, and schedule, you are flexible and willing to dedicate the time and effort needed to ensure the success of each project. Design System Experience: Experience building and maintaining design systems. SC1 About Monks Monks is the global, purely digital, unitary operating brand of S4Capital plc. With a legacy of innovation and specialized expertise, Monks combines an extraordinary range of global marketing and technology services to accelerate business possibilities and redefine how brands and businesses interact with the world. Its integration of systems and workflows delivers unfettered content production, scaled experiences, enterprise-grade technology and data science fueled by AI—managed by the industry’s best and most diverse digital talent—to help the world’s trailblazing companies outmaneuver and outpace their competition. Monks was named a Contender in The Forrester Wave™: Global Marketing Services. It has remained a constant presence on Adweek’s Fastest Growing lists (2019-23), ranks among Cannes Lions' Top 10 Creative Companies (2022-23) and is the only partner to have been placed in AdExchanger’s Programmatic Power Players list every year (2020-24). In addition to being named Adweek’s first AI Agency of the Year (2023), Monks has been recognized by Business Intelligence in its 2024 Excellence in Artificial Intelligence Awards program in three categories: the Individual category, Organizational Winner in AI Strategic Planning and AI Product for its service Monks.Flow. Monks has also garnered the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-24), won a record number of FWAs and has earned a spot on Newsweek’s Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023. We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to building a respectful and empowering work environment for all people to freely express themselves amongst colleagues who embrace diversity in all respects. Including fresh voices and unique points of view in all aspects of our business not only creates an environment where we can all grow and thrive but also increases our potential to produce work that better represents—and resonates with—the world around us.

About the job Job Title: Junior Engineer (Testing) Location: Mumbai, Maharashtra, India *Role Summary* The Junior Engineer is responsible for designing, writing, and executing test scripts using both manual and automated testing frameworks. The role requires using Selenium with C# as the primary coding language. The selected candidate will integrate test suites into the test management system, develop custom test harnesses, and handle various testing-related duties as required. The role reports to the Lead - Quality Engineering and will work closely with Product Management, Development, and QA teams. *Key Responsibilities* Develop and maintain test plans, test labs, and test cases for functional validation Ensure adherence to organizational quality standards and compliance policies Perform functional, regression, and system testing. Collaborate with developers across all stages of the project lifecycle to ensure quality outcomes. Apply strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve issues. Work in an agile environment with quick release cycles and continuous feedback. Select test cases for automation from existing documentation. Design and implement automation frameworks according to project needs. Configure test environments (e.g., Java, Selenium WebDriver, TestNG, IDE setups). Conduct debugging, enhancement, and execution of test cases. Monitor defect management process, handle change requests, and perform regression tests. Resolve issues related to object identity, errors, and test case failures. Coordinate with testing and development teams to resolve issues efficiently. *Required Qualifications* Education: Master’s, Bachelor’s, or Diploma in Computer Science or a related field. Experience: 2–5 years of hands-on experience in manual and automated testing. Skills: Strong experience in Selenium with Java or C#. Knowledge of testing techniques, principles, and heuristics for UI validation. Experience with test script development, defect tracking, and performance testing. Exposure to BDD, Hybrid, or Data-Driven Frameworks. Familiarity with API and database testing (added advantage). Experience working in agile methodologies. Certifications: ISTQB certification in Manual/Automation testing (preferred). *Mandatory Hiring Criteria* Hands-on experience in automation using Selenium and C#. Good communication skills. Strong background in manual testing, including: Understanding of testing concepts. Understanding of testing techniques.

About the job About Payoneer Founded in 2005, Payoneer is the global financial platform that removes friction from doing business across borders, with a mission to connect the world’s underserved businesses to a rising global economy. We’re a community with over 2,500 colleagues all over the world, working to serve customers, and partners in over 190 markets. By taking the complexity out of the financial workflows–including everything from global payments and compliance, to multi-currency and workforce management, to providing working capital and business intelligence–we give businesses the tools they need to work efficiently worldwide and grow with confidence. About The Role As a Product Designer, you will be responsible for leading the design of (complex) applications and websites. This includes conducting user research, creating wireframes and mockups but also a stunning pixel perfect design. During the process you'll be working closely with our cross-functional teams to ensure the final product meets requirements and exceeds their expectations. You like solving problems! Whether you're creating something from scratch or need to add features to something you or your colleagues have been working on before. You'd like to stay ahead at least one step, making sure you'll keep room for future innovation. Responsibilities Working closely with all departments to innovate and build products that customers love Take ownership of all design elements for different business units Drive the creation of a world-class user experience through application of UX, design standards, principles, and usability heuristics. Participate in research and brainstorming sessions to generate ideas, solutions and design concepts that address customer pain points What You Will Need At least 5-10 years of product design experience (working on software products) Proven experience of shipping multiple impactful products end-to-end Excellent verbal and written communication skills, and the willingness and confidence to present your ideas to key stakeholders Skilled in using Figma, Photoshop, Illustrator etc Experience working on a SaaS product Experience working within a cross-functional team in an agile context Experience with the startup culture is a plus Bachelor’s degree in HCI, UX or Product Design UX certification and relevant work experience is also acceptable The Payoneer Ways of Working Act as our customer’s partner on the inside Learning what they need and creating what will help them go further. Continuously improve Always striving for a higher standard than our last. Do it. Own it. Being fearlessly accountable in everything we do. Build Each Other Up Helping each other grow, as professionals and people. If this sounds like a business, a community, and a mission you want to be part of, click now to apply. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive workplace. Payoneer is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment no matter your race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you require reasonable accommodation at any stage of the hiring process, please speak to the recruiter managing the role for any adjustments. Decisions about requests for reasonable accommodation are made on a case-by-case basis.

job_title: Digital S/W Eng Sr Analyst - C12 - CHENNAI
job_description: About the job The Digital S/W Engineer Sr Analyst is a seasoned professional role. Applies in-depth disciplinary knowledge, contributing to the development of new techniques and the improvement of processes and work-flow for the area or function. Integrates subject matter and industry expertise within a defined area. Requires in-depth understanding of how areas collectively integrate within the sub-function as well as coordinate and contribute to the objectives of the function and overall business. Evaluates moderately complex and variable issues with substantial potential impact, where development of an approach/taking of an action involves weighing various alternatives and balancing potentially conflicting situations using multiple sources of information. Requires good analytical skills in order to filter, prioritize and validate potentially complex and dynamic material from multiple sources. Strong communication and diplomacy skills are required. Regularly assumes informal/formal leadership role within teams. Involved in coaching and training of new recruits Significant impact in terms of project size, geography, etc. by influencing decisions through advice, counsel and/or facilitating services to others in area of specialization. Work and performance of all teams in the area are directly affected by the performance of the individual. Responsibilities: Accountable for executing and driving mid-size feature application design and development efforts to completion, serving as a development lead on medium-scale projects and supporting the execution of larger efforts. Proficient at operating with considerable autonomy and discretion as you will significantly influence the way an application is designed and developed by providing subject specific expertise and an advanced level of understanding of application programming principles. Sought after due to ability to analyze and troubleshoot coding, application performance and design challenges. Capable of research in root cause of development and performance concerns as well as the resolution of defects. Have a deep understanding of the technical requirements for the solutions being built. Understand engineering needs including those required to build, maintain, and operate the system through all phases of its life. Proficient in information modeling, data structures and algorithms. Understand maintenance characteristics, runtime properties and dependencies that exist in support of your system’s software. These dependencies will include but not limited to: hardware, platform, operating system, performance and load requirements, as well as contingencies with upstream and downstream systems. Demonstrate an advanced understanding of supported main system flows and possess a comprehensive understanding of how the system and others (i.e. architecture or infrastructure) collectively integrate to contribute towards achieving business objectives. Using this expertise, assist with the development of standards for coding, testing, debugging and implementation. This will ensure application design adheres to the overall architecture blueprint. Participate in design discussions as a Development Lead and as such will play the part of a key decision maker in driving design decisions. This is evidenced by your knowledge of the application code details and your experience with the technology and teams engaged. Work with limited guidance, seeking guidance only as needed as the development and delivery strategy is defined; the design is not. Exhibit the ability to turn complex application design into a well written application. Partner with industry vendors that provide technology or user experience design components that support our Digital architecture and work with vendors on our implementation plans and roadmaps identifying partnership opportunities to increase our development velocity and our learnings. Participates in the full development life cycle, identify dependencies between agile and waterfall delivery, working within broadly defined parameters, including test plan execution and software quality needs Directly impact the business by influencing strategic functional decisions through advice, counsel or provided services. This will require persuading and influencing others through strong and comprehensive communication and diplomacy skills. Communicate progress, anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management, identify, assess, track and mitigate issues/risks at multiple levels. Recognize discordant views and take part in constructive dialog to resolve them. Work across teams to optimize processes. Regularly review metrics and proactively seek out new and improved mechanisms for visibility ensuring your program stays aligned with organization objectives. Continuously assess development processes, test plans, and operations. Work with teams to improve concurrent project delivery. Streamline and / or eliminate excess process in any area of architecture, build, delivery, production operations environment, or business area where the same efforts (or issues) are repeated year-over-year. Share knowledge with the team in various forums (brown bags, engineering forums etc.) and demonstrate a higher level of knowledge through industry certifications Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency. Qualifications: 5-8 years in a product development/product management environment Strong analytical and quantitative skills; Data driven and results-oriented Experience delivering with an agile methodology Experience in affecting large culture change Experience leading infrastructure programs Skilled at working with third party service providers Excellent written and oral communication skills Education: Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience ------------------------------------------------------ Job Family Group: Technology ------------------------------------------------------ Job Family: Digital Software Engineering ------------------------------------------------------ Time Type: Full time ------------------------------------------------------ Most Relevant Skills Please see the requirements listed above. ------------------------------------------------------ Other Relevant Skills For complementary skills, please see above and/or contact the recruiter. ------------------------------------------------------ Citi is an equal opportunity employer, and qualified candidates will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you are a person with a disability and need a reasonable accommodation to use our search tools and/or apply for a career opportunity review Accessibility at Citi . View Citi’s EEO Policy Statement and the Know Your Rights poster.

job_title: Senior UX Designer, IES SX Design
job_description: About the job Description Amazon India is seeking a creative, thoughtful and customer-obsessed UX Designer to help us define the future of Selling Partner Experience in India. The mission of the team is to innovate tools and technology that enables millions of Selling Partners operate, grow their business online and serve billions of buying customers worldwide in the most efficient, effective and delightful way. In this role, you will work on to solve for current selling partner problems and define long term strategic initiatives to shape how our Selling Partners run their business across different channels and using different form factors. You will closely collaborate with a team of Product Managers, Researchers, Designers, Engineers and work with business and UX leadership to improve how Selling Partners conduct their business on Amazon. You’ll drive UX design from early-stage concepts all the way through final delivery and launch. The role requires a design lead who is responsive, flexible and able to succeed in a fast-paced environment with a high-degree of independence and ownership to thrive in collaborative work environments while raising the bar for user experience and accessibility. Key job responsibilities Create world-class, user-centered designs through consideration of market research, business requirements, customer feedback, domain/industry workflow patterns, and usability study findings. Understand the end to end customer journey, the friction points within, and how your proposed CX solution impacts that path and others. Drive exploration of new experiences to help Selling Partners get the maximum out of selling on Amazon Confidently defend design rationale in reviews with leadership. Codify designs into written guidelines and requirements. Collaborate with Product, Engineering, and other UX Designers to ensure a consistent and delightful experience across all product/services in the digital content creation space. About The Team IES Design team is part of International Emerging Stores (IES) and focuses on customer shopping and selling experiences for emerging markets. Basic Qualifications 8+ years of UX designer or interaction designer experience Have an online portfolio or samples of work on resume, demonstrating experience creating great end-to-end, user-centered design solutions and patterns, across desktop and mobile devices Knowledge of best practices for information architecture and design Experience working with stakeholders to plan and execute programs that are strategic in nature Knowledge of usability principles and techniques Preferred Qualifications Experience with UX design of complex workflows Experience designing customer facing retail products Experience in delivering design solutions for projects of large scope and complexity Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner. Company - ASSPL - Karnataka - B56 Job ID: A2929059

About the job Must be able to understand and implement hooks to the backend infotainment system, as well, and to navigate and manipulate UX tools such as Figma. Technical skills: AAOS, AOSP, & AOSP Build Process, Android & Android Lifecycle, Android Studio & Build Tools, ADB, AIDL/HIDL, Kotlin, Java, etc. Bootloaders, Secure Boot, AutoSAR, Flexray, CAN, LIN, etc. Join our core R&D Automotive Engineering Team for our marquee Swedish Account- Polestar! Infosys is hiring core Automotive R&D professionals as part of a dedicated Offshore Delivery Center being setup for Sweden’s marquee EV brand ‘Polestar’ at our Electronics City, Bangalore Campus. This is an opportunity to be part of cutting edge automotive software projects, working with passionate global teams tackling real-world Automotive and next-generation Electric Mobility Challenges. If such an opportunity excites you, apply for the job opening below - Automotive experience of at least 8 years Prior experience in Automotive or related companies Has deep knowledge of Automotive Infotainment development Should have experience creating upper level of Android Automotive Infotainment systems, creating system apps and in-car apps Knowledge of Android Automotive OS mandatory Knowledge of modern UX design and development techniques relevant for 2D and 3D displays in CSD (CENTER STACK DISPLAY), DIM (Driver Information Module) based on Android, QNX, Unreal, Unity, etc. If you are passionate about cars and cutting edge technologies, committed to delivering high quality software and, someone with strong analytical and problem solving skills, then this is the right job for you!

About the job Roles & Responsibilities Create comprehensive design deliverables, including detailed wireframes, user journeys, mock-ups, information architecture, site maps, and user interfaces. Transform user needs and business requirements into intuitive interfaces, employing adept UX principles, storytelling, AI tools, and established design patterns. Build presentations, craft documentation, and deliver asset kits to developers and other team members. Engage in a hybrid work environment, collaborating online and in-person with a multidisciplinary team that values diverse perspectives and expertise. Anticipates change and identifies needs proactively; proposes actions or acts on needs as they arise. Maintain consistent quality across projects and keep an understanding of project goals/guidelines/core value props in mind. Participate in client meetings, providing strategic input and presenting design solutions effectively. Manage project work effectively across time zones, proactively seek appropriate help or guidance, and seek growth through professional development. Promotes team atmosphere through a positive attitude and acknowledges peer contributions. At Atlys , we believe that the path to creating a more open world is by making it efficient to travel. We're looking for talented people who are interested in building the future of travel alongside us. Building technology to increase global movement liquidity will be one of the most exciting developments in decades. If you are curious why the smartest people want to work at Atlys, read this post . Job requirements We're looking for a motivated and creative Product Design Intern to join our team! In this role, you’ll work closely with our product leads and gain hands-on experience turning user insights into thoughtful design solutions. About the job Before you apply to a job, select your language preference from the options available at the top right of this page. Explore your next opportunity at a Fortune Global 500 organization. Envision innovative possibilities, experience our rewarding culture, and work with talented teams that help you become better every day. We know what it takes to lead UPS into tomorrow—people with a unique combination of skill + passion. If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level. Job Description Job Description UPS is seeking a motivated and experienced Senior UX Designer to join our Digital Experience team. In this role, you will own end-to-end design initiatives, collaborating closely with product managers, researchers, engineers, and fellow designers to deliver intuitive, accessible, and scalable digital experiences that support the world’s most trusted logistics network. You’ll act as a design leader, advocating for user-centered solutions, mentoring junior designers, and contributing to our enterprise-level design system. Responsibilities Lead Design Projects: Own the UX design lifecycle for complex web and mobile applications—from initial discovery and user research through wireframing, high-fidelity prototyping, usability testing, and final handoff. Drive UX Strategy: Partner with product stakeholders to define user experience goals, translate business requirements into design concepts, and ensure alignment with overall product vision. Design System Governance: Contribute to the evolution of our enterprise design system and UI component library. Establish and enforce design standards, patterns, and best practices to maintain consistency across multiple products and platforms. User Research & Validation: Plan and facilitate user interviews, focus groups, and usability studies. Synthesize research findings into personas, user journeys, and actionable insights that inform design decisions. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Product Management and Engineering to ensure designs are technically feasible, accessible (WCAG AA or higher), and performant. Align on implementation details, provide design specifications, and participate in sprint ceremonies as needed. Visual & Interaction Design: Create polished, pixel-perfect mockups, interactive prototypes, and detailed UI specifications using tools like Figma, Sketch, or Adobe XD. Communicate interaction patterns, micro-animations, and motion guidelines. Mentorship & Leadership: Provide guidance, feedback, and coaching to junior and mid-level designers. Participate in design critiques, facilitate workshops, and help establish a culture of continuous improvement. Stakeholder Communication: Present design concepts, trade-off analyses, and research summaries to senior leadership. Advocate for users by articulating design rationale and quantifying expected impact (e.g., engagement metrics, task success rates). Continuous Improvement: Stay current with industry trends, emerging tools, and best practices in UX, UI, and accessibility. Identify opportunities to optimize existing workflows, introduce new methodologies (e.g., design ops), and share learnings with the broader team. Qualifications Experience: 5+ years of hands-on UX/UI design experience in an enterprise or large-scale environment, with a portfolio showcasing complex, end-to-end projects (web and mobile). Education: Bachelor’s degree (or higher) in Human-Computer Interaction, Interaction Design, Graphic Design, Computer Science, Psychology, or a related field. Equivalent experience may be considered. Design Tools & Prototyping: Expert proficiency in Figma for wireframing, high-fidelity mockups, and interactive prototyping. User Research & Testing: Demonstrated experience designing and moderating user research sessions, conducting usability tests (remote and in-person), and translating findings into design decisions and metrics. Design Systems & Component Libraries: Hands-on experience building, maintaining, or scaling a design system (e.g., defining tokens, components, and documentation). Ability to collaborate with engineering teams to implement and evolve shared UI libraries. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Proven track record of partnering effectively with product managers, engineers, and researchers to drive alignment and deliver high-quality user experiences. Ability to balance business objectives, technical constraints, and user needs. Accessibility & Inclusive Design: Solid understanding of accessibility standards (WCAG 2.1 AA or higher) and inclusive design principles. Experience auditing interfaces for accessibility and implementing remediation strategies. Visual & Interaction Design: Strong visual design chops, attention to typography, spacing, color theory, and interaction detail. Experience defining motion guidelines and micro-interactions to enhance usability. Communication & Leadership: Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to present design rationale and data-driven insights to senior leadership. Prior experience mentoring or leading other designers is highly desirable. Technical Familiarity: Basic understanding of front-end technologies (HTML/CSS/JavaScript or React) to facilitate handoff and collaboration with engineering teams. Portfolio: Submit a portfolio or work samples demonstrating your process—from research and ideation through prototyping, visual design, and final implementation. Preferred Qualifications Experience working in a logistics, supply chain, or enterprise SaaS environment. Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies and working within two-week sprint cycles. Experience using analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Mixpanel) to measure user behavior and inform design decisions. Familiarity with agile project management tools such as Jira or Azure DevOps. Employee Type Permanent UPS is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

About the job Product Design (UX) Researcher Who We Are Brightly, a Siemens company, is a leading provider of cloud-based operations management software to optimize facilities, assets, and workflow. We empower our clients and our people, combining innovative technology with operational insight to transform the places we learn, live, heal, work, and play. We’re both proud and humbled to play a role in the daily operations of so many clients, and we look forward to continually drive innovation, efficiency, and safety throughout the markets we serve. About The Job We are seeking a strategic and impact-driven Product Design Researcher to uncover deep insights into user behaviors, needs, and motivations that shape our products. You’ll collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to create customer experience maps, journey maps, and ecosystem mappings, ensuring a seamless and intuitive user journey. As a key member of the Product Design team, you will tackle complex challenges and translate research into actionable, user-centered solutions that drive meaningful outcomes for our clients across manufacturing, education, healthcare, and government. Beyond your expertise, we value curiosity, collaboration, and a passion for problem-solving. If you thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth environment where research and design drive innovation, Brightly is the place for you. Join us and help shape products that make a real impact on the people and industries we serve. What You’ll Be Doing : Design, plan, and execute comprehensive user research studies utilizing both qualitative and quantitative methods to uncover actionable insights. : Collaborate with stakeholders to develop customer experience maps, journey maps, and ecosystem mappings, ensuring a holistic understanding of user interactions. : Work closely with product managers, designers, engineers, and other stakeholders to integrate research findings into product development and strategic decisions. : Champion the importance of product design and research across the organization, ensuring user insights are at the forefront of product strategy. : Guide and mentor team members and stakeholders in best practices for user research, fostering a culture of continuous learning and empathy-driven design. : Translate complex research findings into clear, actionable recommendations and present them to diverse audiences, including senior leadership. : Keep up-to-date with the latest research methodologies, tools, and industry trends to continually refine and enhance our research practices. What does success look like? : You deeply understand user needs, immersing yourself in their challenges to ensure our products help them achieve their goals. : You actively collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to integrate research into product strategy, driving research-backed decisions that enhance the user experience. : You engage cross-functional teams—including Product Design, Product Managers, Data Scientists, Product Operations, and Client Services—fostering open dialogue and ensuring solutions align with business and technical requirements. : You work closely with engineers, sharing design rationale and aligning on technical feasibility. You lead interactive workshops with Engineering to define long-term design vision and break it into actionable, iterative steps. Qualifications & Experience Bachelor’s degree in HCI, Cognitive Science, Psychology, Behavioral Economics, Anthropology, Statistics, or a related field—or equivalent practical experience. 5+ years of UX research experience, with at least 3 years working on complex enterprise products in a SaaS, marketplace, or agile B2B environment. Experience conducting research for both web and mobile applications in applied settings. Strong proficiency in user interviews, usability testing, surveys, and contextual inquiries to uncover actionable insights. Skilled in research and design tools such as Figma, Miro, Maze, and Dovetail, or similar platforms. Proven ability to collaborate within cross-functional teams, integrating research into product strategy. Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights. Strong communication and presentation skills, effectively articulating findings to diverse stakeholders. Proactive mindset with a passion for advocating for user needs and driving user-centered design solutions. Willingness to travel up to 15% as needed. Behavioral Competencies : Strong conviction in UX research decisions while remaining open to feedback and collaboration to achieve the best outcomes. : Thrives in challenges, overcoming setbacks with creativity, persistence, and an innovative mindset. : Takes ownership, leads by example, and drives initiatives with enthusiasm and conviction. : Outgoing, collaborative, and adaptable, with a positive attitude and the ability to influence and inspire others. Shine Brightly We are always looking for people that bring new perspectives and life experiences to our team. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspire innovation that runs through everything we do. At the core of our unique culture are our people – so we expect our candidates to have all the “right stuff”. If you are a big thinker, have a passion for technology and great people, embrace creativity, and are genuine in both words and actions, then get ready to do something incredible. Join our team and shine brightly!

job_title: Digital S/W Eng Sr Analyst - C12 - CHENNAI
job_description: About the job The Digital S/W Engineer Sr Analyst is a seasoned professional role. Applies in-depth disciplinary knowledge, contributing to the development of new techniques and the improvement of processes and work-flow for the area or function. Integrates subject matter and industry expertise within a defined area. Requires in-depth understanding of how areas collectively integrate within the sub-function as well as coordinate and contribute to the objectives of the function and overall business. Evaluates moderately complex and variable issues with substantial potential impact, where development of an approach/taking of an action involves weighing various alternatives and balancing potentially conflicting situations using multiple sources of information. Requires good analytical skills in order to filter, prioritize and validate potentially complex and dynamic material from multiple sources. Strong communication and diplomacy skills are required. Regularly assumes informal/formal leadership role within teams. Involved in coaching and training of new recruits Significant impact in terms of project size, geography, etc. by influencing decisions through advice, counsel and/or facilitating services to others in area of specialization. Work and performance of all teams in the area are directly affected by the performance of the individual. Responsibilities: Accountable for executing and driving mid-size feature application design and development efforts to completion, serving as a development lead on medium-scale projects and supporting the execution of larger efforts. Proficient at operating with considerable autonomy and discretion as you will significantly influence the way an application is designed and developed by providing subject specific expertise and an advanced level of understanding of application programming principles. Sought after due to ability to analyze and troubleshoot coding, application performance and design challenges. Capable of research in root cause of development and performance concerns as well as the resolution of defects. Have a deep understanding of the technical requirements for the solutions being built. Understand engineering needs including those required to build, maintain, and operate the system through all phases of its life. Proficient in information modeling, data structures and algorithms. Understand maintenance characteristics, runtime properties and dependencies that exist in support of your system’s software. These dependencies will include but not limited to: hardware, platform, operating system, performance and load requirements, as well as contingencies with upstream and downstream systems. Demonstrate an advanced understanding of supported main system flows and possess a comprehensive understanding of how the system and others (i.e. architecture or infrastructure) collectively integrate to contribute towards achieving business objectives. Using this expertise, assist with the development of standards for coding, testing, debugging and implementation. This will ensure application design adheres to the overall architecture blueprint. Participate in design discussions as a Development Lead and as such will play the part of a key decision maker in driving design decisions. This is evidenced by your knowledge of the application code details and your experience with the technology and teams engaged. Work with limited guidance, seeking guidance only as needed as the development and delivery strategy is defined; the design is not. Exhibit the ability to turn complex application design into a well written application. Partner with industry vendors that provide technology or user experience design components that support our Digital architecture and work with vendors on our implementation plans and roadmaps identifying partnership opportunities to increase our development velocity and our learnings. Participates in the full development life cycle, identify dependencies between agile and waterfall delivery, working within broadly defined parameters, including test plan execution and software quality needs Directly impact the business by influencing strategic functional decisions through advice, counsel or provided services. This will require persuading and influencing others through strong and comprehensive communication and diplomacy skills. Communicate progress, anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management, identify, assess, track and mitigate issues/risks at multiple levels. Recognize discordant views and take part in constructive dialog to resolve them. Work across teams to optimize processes. Regularly review metrics and proactively seek out new and improved mechanisms for visibility ensuring your program stays aligned with organization objectives. Continuously assess development processes, test plans, and operations. Work with teams to improve concurrent project delivery. Streamline and / or eliminate excess process in any area of architecture, build, delivery, production operations environment, or business area where the same efforts (or issues) are repeated year-over-year. Share knowledge with the team in various forums (brown bags, engineering forums etc.) and demonstrate a higher level of knowledge through industry certifications Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency. Qualifications: 5-8 years in a product development/product management environment Strong analytical and quantitative skills; Data driven and results-oriented Experience delivering with an agile methodology Experience in affecting large culture change Experience leading infrastructure programs Skilled at working with third party service providers Excellent written and oral communication skills Education: Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience ------------------------------------------------------ Job Family Group: Technology ------------------------------------------------------ Job Family: Digital Software Engineering ------------------------------------------------------ Time Type: Full time ------------------------------------------------------ Most Relevant Skills Please see the requirements listed above. ------------------------------------------------------ Other Relevant Skills For complementary skills, please see above and/or contact the recruiter. ------------------------------------------------------ Citi is an equal opportunity employer, and qualified candidates will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other characteristic protected by law. job_title: Senior UX Researcher, AI Experience Accelerator
job_description: About the job Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Hyderabad, Telangana, India; Bengaluru, Karnataka, India . Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 5 years of experience in an applied research setting, or similar. Preferred qualifications: Master's degree or PhD in Human-Computer Interaction, Cognitive Science, Statistics, Psychology, Anthropology, or related field. 5 years of experience conducting UX research on products and working with executive leadership (e.g., Director level and above). 3 years of experience managing projects, and working in a large, matrixed organization. About The Job At Google, we follow a simple but vital premise: "Focus on the user and all else will follow." User Experience Researchers (UXRs) make this possible. Google User Experience (UX) is made up of multi-disciplinary teams of UX Designers, Researchers, Writers, Content Strategists, Program Managers, and Engineers: we care deeply about the people who use our products. The UX team plays an integral part in gathering insights about the needs, attitudes, emotions, and behaviors of people who use our products to inspire and inform design. We collaborate closely with each other and with engineering and product management to create industry-leading products that deliver value for the people who use them, and for Google’s businesses. As a User Experience Researcher (UXR), you’ll help your team of UXers, product managers, and engineers understand user needs. You’ll work with stakeholders across functions and levels and have impact at all stages of product development. You’ll play a critical role in creating useful, usable, and delightful products. You’ll explore user behaviors and motivations by conducting primary research such as field studies, interviews, diary studies, participatory workshops, ethnography, surveys, usability testing, and logs analysis. The UXR community at Google is unique and will help you do your best work. You’ll have the opportunity to work with and learn from UXRs across Google through regular meetups, mentor programs, and access to internal research tools. At Corp Eng, we build world-leading business solutions that scale a more helpful Google for everyone. As Google’s IT organization, we provide end-to-end solutions for organizations across Google. We deliver the right tools, platforms, and experiences for all Googlers as they create more helpful products and services for everyone. In the simplest terms, we are Google for Googlers. Responsibilities Influence stakeholders across organizations to gain support for research-based, user-centric solutions. Own project priorities in alignment with larger product goals, and oversee allocation of resources within the project. Drive ideas to improve products and services through research-driven insights and recommendations. Lead teams to define and evaluate product, service, and ecosystem impact. Own vision and strategy discussions through research by analyzing, consolidating, or synthesizing what is known about user, product, service, or business needs. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

In this role, you will own end-to-end design initiatives, collaborating closely with product managers, researchers, engineers, and fellow designers to deliver intuitive, accessible, and scalable digital experiences that support the world’s most trusted logistics network. You’ll act as a design leader, advocating for user-centered solutions, mentoring junior designers, and contributing to our enterprise-level design system. Responsibilities Lead Design Projects: Own the UX design lifecycle for complex web and mobile applications—from initial discovery and user research through wireframing, high-fidelity prototyping, usability testing, and final handoff. Drive UX Strategy: Partner with product stakeholders to define user experience goals, translate business requirements into design concepts, and ensure alignment with overall product vision. Design System Governance: Contribute to the evolution of our enterprise design system and UI component library. Establish and enforce design standards, patterns, and best practices to maintain consistency across multiple products and platforms. User Research & Validation: Plan and facilitate user interviews, focus groups, and usability studies. Synthesize research findings into personas, user journeys, and actionable insights that inform design decisions. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Product Management and Engineering to ensure designs are technically feasible, accessible (WCAG AA or higher), and performant. Align on implementation details, provide design specifications, and participate in sprint ceremonies as needed. Visual & Interaction Design: Create polished, pixel-perfect mockups, interactive prototypes, and detailed UI specifications using tools like Figma, Sketch, or Adobe XD. Communicate interaction patterns, micro-animations, and motion guidelines. Mentorship & Leadership: Provide guidance, feedback, and coaching to junior and mid-level designers. Participate in design critiques, facilitate workshops, and help establish a culture of continuous improvement. Stakeholder Communication: Present design concepts, trade-off analyses, and research summaries to senior leadership. Advocate for users by articulating design rationale and quantifying expected impact (e.g., engagement metrics, task success rates). Continuous Improvement: Stay current with industry trends, emerging tools, and best practices in UX, UI, and accessibility. Identify opportunities to optimize existing workflows, introduce new methodologies (e.g., design ops), and share learnings with the broader team. Qualifications Experience: 5+ years of hands-on UX/UI design experience in an enterprise or large-scale environment, with a portfolio showcasing complex, end-to-end projects (web and mobile). Education: Bachelor’s degree (or higher) in Human-Computer Interaction, Interaction Design, Graphic Design, Computer Science, Psychology, or a related field. Equivalent experience may be considered. Design Tools & Prototyping: Expert proficiency in Figma for wireframing, high-fidelity mockups, and interactive prototyping. User Research & Testing: Demonstrated experience designing and moderating user research sessions, conducting usability tests (remote and in-person), and translating findings into design decisions and metrics. Design Systems & Component Libraries: Hands-on experience building, maintaining, or scaling a design system (e.g., defining tokens, components, and documentation). Ability to collaborate with engineering teams to implement and evolve shared UI libraries. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Proven track record of partnering effectively with product managers, engineers, and researchers to drive alignment and deliver high-quality user experiences. Ability to balance business objectives, technical constraints, and user needs. Accessibility & Inclusive Design: Solid understanding of accessibility standards (WCAG 2.1 AA or higher) and inclusive design principles. Experience auditing interfaces for accessibility and implementing remediation strategies. Visual & Interaction Design: Strong visual design chops, attention to typography, spacing, color theory, and interaction detail. Experience defining motion guidelines and micro-interactions to enhance usability. Communication & Leadership: Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to present design rationale and data-driven insights to senior leadership. Prior experience mentoring or leading other designers is highly desirable. Technical Familiarity: Basic understanding of front-end technologies (HTML/CSS/JavaScript or React) to facilitate handoff and collaboration with engineering teams. Portfolio: Submit a portfolio or work samples demonstrating your process—from research and ideation through prototyping, visual design, and final implementation. Preferred Qualifications Experience working in a logistics, supply chain, or enterprise SaaS environment. Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies and working within two-week sprint cycles. Experience using analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Mixpanel) to measure user behavior and inform design decisions. Familiarity with agile project management tools such as Jira or Azure DevOps. Employee Type Permanent UPS is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

About the job Role -Application Solution Architect (UI/UX) Experience - 10 YR 15YRS Location- Pan India. Work closely with UX, Design and Product to understand and build web application from scratch. Deliver functional and testable code with thorough unit testing to satisfy effective DevOps pipeline. Interact with team members from onsite and offshore and also other stakeholders on requirement gathering, coding, implementation and continuous improvements to code. About the job Senior UX Designer: Design the Future of a Trustworthy Internet with qikfox, Inc. NOTE: Please share your work portfolio along with the resume. This position is for a senior resource. You have have (at minimum) completed at least two product design cycles working closely with Product teams. Location: Noida (On-site, Full Time) At qikfox, we're on an exciting journey to revolutionize the Internet. Our vision is to create an online world that is safe, secure, and reliable. We need creative, innovative minds to help bring this vision to life. We are currently seeking a highly motivated, experienced User Experience (UX) Designer to join our dynamic team. Key Responsibilities: Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to conceptualize and design innovative solutions for our products, including the qikfox Smart Browser and Safe Search Engine. Understand our users’ needs, behaviors, and emotions to gather insights that inform product strategy and design. Create user-centered designs by analyzing business requirements, user journeys, and usability findings. Develop wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity designs across multiple platforms. Contribute to the development and continuous improvement of our product design process. Desired Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Design, Computer Science, or a related field (exceptions are acceptable for experienced designers). A minimum of 4 years of experience as a UX Designer, UI Designer, or in a similar role. A portfolio demonstrating strong design skills, creativity, and a deep understanding of UX methodologies. Proficiency in design software (such as Sketch, Figma, or Adobe XD) and familiarity with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Exceptional problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and the ability to think creatively and holistically. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. More About qikfox: Reinventing the Future of the Internet At qikfox, we're not just another tech company—we’re on an exhilarating journey to reinvent the Internet as we know it. Headquartered in the heart of Silicon Valley, we are a venture-backed company driven by the ambition to create a next-generation Internet built on trust. Our success comes not only from our advanced technologies, game-changing protocols, and innovative products, but also from our dedicated, passionate team and our ever-growing community. Our vision goes beyond the ordinary. We aim to shape a future where both centralized and decentralized Internet infrastructures embody safety, security, and reliability. In addition to these core elements, we are committed to delivering exceptional consumer experiences and practical utility for both individuals and businesses. As a bold testament to our dedication, we have already launched the immensely popular qikfox Smart Browser and Safe Search Engine. These offerings—underpinned by our focus on safety, security, and privacy—have received overwhelmingly positive feedback, setting the stage for an inspiring journey ahead. Join us in revolutionizing the Internet. At qikfox, you're not just an employee; you're an architect of a safer, more secure digital future. qikfox is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you're ready to reshape the Internet with us, apply now!

About the job About ETS ETS is a global education and talent solutions organization enabling lifelong learners worldwide to be future-ready. For more than 75 years, we've been advancing the science of measurement to build benchmarks for fair and valid skill assessment across cultures and borders. Our worldwide impact extends through our renowned assessments including TOEFL®, TOEIC®, GRE® and Praxis® tests, serving millions of learners in more than 200 countries and territories. Through strategic acquisitions, we've expanded our global capabilities: PSI strengthens our workforce assessment solutions, while Edusoft, Kira Talent, Pipplet, Vericant, and Wheebox enhance our educational technology and assessment platforms across critical markets worldwide. Through ETS Research Institute and ETS Solutions, we're partnering with educational institutions, governments, and organizations globally to promote skill proficiency, empower upward mobility, and unlock opportunities for everyone, everywhere. With offices and partners across Asia, Europe, the Middle East, Africa, and the Americas, we deliver nearly 50 million tests annually. Join us in our journey of measuring progress to power human progress worldwide. We’re looking for a thoughtful and creative UX/UI Designer with a passion for designing web-based experiences that drive meaningful user actions —whether that’s submitting a lead form, exploring key content, or completing a purchase. With 3-5 years of experience , the ideal candidate brings a strong user-centered mindset and a proven ability to translate complex requirements into elegant, intuitive, and performance-driven design solutions. You’ll work closely with product owners, marketers, and developers to create high-impact digital experiences that guide users through intentional journeys across our websites Responsibilities Design and prototype user experiences that align with business objectives—whether optimizing for lead capture, engagement, or online transactions. Develop user flows, wireframes, high-fidelity mockups, and interactive prototypes that support both marketing and commerce experiences. Apply UX best practices to streamline key customer journeys, reduce friction, and increase conversion across different types of user paths. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to validate designs through A/B testing, user feedback, and behavioral analytics. Contribute to and maintain a consistent design system, ensuring visual and functional cohesion across all web experiences. Help identify user pain points and opportunities for improvement through research, heuristics, and usability evaluations. Education, Certifications, Or Special Licenses A Bachelor’s degree or higher in design and/or technology-related field of study (computer science, information technology, educational technology, Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), user design, or web/graphic design) or the equivalent combination of education and experience from which comparable knowledge, experience, certification can be acquired is required. Relevant Years Of Experience Required Three (3) or more years of professional experience in web design Experience designing for lead generation, online transactions, or personalized content journeys. Familiarity with A/B testing tools like Optimizely, Adobe Target, or Google Optimize. Exposure to CMS and commerce platforms such as AEM and Salesforce Commerce Cloud Understanding of accessibility standards (WCAG) and inclusive design principles. Required Skills A strong portfolio showcasing thoughtful design work that improves user outcomes and meets business goals. Proficiency with Figma (or similar tools), and an understanding of how design decisions impact development (HTML/CSS awareness is a plus). Experience designing responsive, mobile-friendly interfaces. Comfort working in Agile environments and with cross-disciplinary stakeholders including marketing, product, and engineering teams. Strong communication and problem-solving skills with an ability to advocate for the user while balancing business needs. ETS is mission driven and action oriented We are passionate about hiring innovative thinkers who believe in the promise of education and lifelong learning. We are energized by cultivating growth, innovation, and continuous transformation for the next generation of rising professionals as leaders. Â In support of this ETS offers multiple Business Resource Groups (BRG) for you to learn and advance your career growth! As a not-for-profit organization we will encourage you to lean in to your passion for volunteering. Â At ETS you may qualify for up to an additional 8 hours of PTO for volunteer work on causes that are important to you! ETS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected by law. We believe in creating a work environment where all individuals are treated with respect and dignity.
